concept_description:
The Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA) was a deal between Iran, the United States, China, Russia, and key European Union countries. Every signatory other than the Eurpean Union, Germany, and Iran posess nuclear weapons. The JCPOA removed all sanctions on Iran in exchange for Iran agreeing to IAEA (International Atomic Energy Agency) inspections of its Nuclear program, in addition to a committment not to pursue nuclear weapons, and dispose of enriched Uranium Stocks.

In 2017 president Trump pulled the United States out of the JCPOA, subsequently the United States unilaterally imposed sactions on companies of other signatories causing it to be untennable, and for all intents and puroses terminating the agreement by making it impossible for other signatories to conduct trade with Iran without facing crippling U.S. sanctions.

The China-United States trade war is an ongoing trade conflict between the United States and China.  It was initiated in January 2018 by the Trump Administration, at the behest of U.S. business interests seeking more access to the Chinese market. The primary weapon used by both sides in the trade war has been sanctions which have negatively impacted both countries.  In the United States it has resulted in higher manufacturing costs, which have been passed on to consumers, and in China it has led to decreased industrial output.  Some countries, such as Brazil have benefitted by agricultual exports to China increasing as China sought alternate import sources.  Other countries, such as Vietnam have benefitted by manufacturing moving from China into their nations.

Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership, (RCEP) unites China, Japan and South Korea in a trade deal for the first time and includes 10 Southeast Asian countries plus Australia and New Zealand. It mixes rich countries, such as Japan and Australia with poorer ones such as Laos and Cambodia.

It is a complex trade deal which provides free trade in some instances, but in other instances allows certain trading partners to maintain tarrifs to protect their markets. For example, Japan can maintain tariffs on rice, wheat, dairy products, sugar, beef and pork to protect its farmers, while tariffs on technology products and services are dropped. India is not a party to this trade pact, nor is the United States.

The COVID-19 pandemic, also known as the coronavirus pandemic, is an ongoing global pandemic of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). The novel virus was first identified from an outbreak in the Chinese city of Wuhan in December 2019, and attempts to contain it there failed, allowing it to spread across the globe. The World Health Organization (WHO) declared a Public Health Emergency of International Concern on 30 January 2020 and a pandemic on 11 March 2020. As of 5 March 2022, the pandemic had caused more than 443 million cases and 5.99 million deaths, making it one of the deadliest in history.
